column5: I was diagnosed with parkinsons in 2013, I'm about maxed out on my meds and the relief time they provideÂ  keeps shorter and shorter. My last visit to the neurologist at the Cleveland clinic they suggested DBS (deep brain stimulation) surgery. I was wondering if anyone here has had this procedure done or know anyone who has. Thx.
Can't help you at all with your question Tom but best of luck in the future.
There is a huge amount of information online Tom, including an article from the Mayo Clinic.
Tom, MS myself and this site may help with questions? https://www.neurotalk.org/parkinson-s-disease/?s=119ed60b2fe0a1c85a09f1789d48aa87
Best of luck to you Tom. I hope whatever path you choose turns out to be beneficial. I wish I could help
Ok thanks you guy's, I've read up on it, I thought it would be nice to get some first hand info if I could.
Not sure about that procedure but I hope that if you try it that it works for you! My father suffered from Parkinson's for many years before he passed a few years ago! Best of luck!
